title: Private network with a single/dual miner - non-mining nodes don't sync
body:
#### System information

Geth version: 1.4.7
OS & Version: Linux Ubuntu 14.0.4
Commit hash : 1.4.7 tag
#### Expected behaviour

Non-mining nodes should download blocks and sync-up properly
#### Actual behaviour

Most of the nodes don't sync up, those that do stop sometimes syncing after ~1000 blocks
#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
- Create a private test network with X non mining nodes, all having a dedocated single/two miner node(s) in static_nodes.json file.
- Use the workaround from fixing the sync issue https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/issues/2769

The problem occurs faster if the initial difficulty is set up really low in the genesis.json, many nodes never catch with the miners and are stuck at block 0. For high difficulties (and high block times) clients get stuck around block 900-1000.

command used to start the non-mining nodes:

`
geth --password password --rpccorsdomain "*" --genesis genesis_block.json --rpcapi "admin,db,eth,debug,miner,net,shh,txpool,personal,web3" --metrics --rpcaddr 0.0.0.0 --unlock 0 --nodiscover --fast --port 30303 --networkid 1123 --rpc --rpcport 8545 --verbosity 6
`
#### Backtrace

Screenshot from ethstats:

![ethstats](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8530155/16872021/90e564cc-4a8a-11e6-990d-1f9646636bc7.PNG)

Update:

I have also been experimenting with a two-miner setup, the same problem appears, many clients stop synchronizing around block 1000.

Screenshot from ethstats:

![untitled](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8530155/17052596/82cf3498-4ffe-11e6-902c-0bc7384c3ce0.png)

Logs from one of the de-synced clients:


@fjl  or @karalabe another ticket for 'Private Network' label.

Update:
The problem goes away when all the non-mining nodes are connected to each other, previously they only knew about miner nodes. 

Synchronozation issues still occur but only if the global transaction rate is higher than 100tx/s, some nodes stop syncing and never catch up.

If I understand correctly, your first topology were that all nodes were connected only to the miners. This can be problematic as the miners are heavily loaded churning out blocks, so if everyone is bugging them to distribute the data too, I can imagine that they are simply overwhelmed (you essentially DDOS the miners).

I'd recommend enabling discovery (with a custom bootnode, maybe one of the miners, should be fine) so nodes can properly connect to each other and form a decent overlay network to propagate the data.

As for very high transaction rates, our txpool implementation was quite suboptimal if high throughput was maintained for prolonged amounts of times (especially fi they accumulated up too). We have an open PR to address this. Perhaps you can try that PR out (merged against develop) https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/pull/2742.
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.
